body.p:
Mt. Sterling Ky. March 11th '64
To His Excellency
Gov. Bramlette

Sir. At the last term of our Court an indictment was found against Mrs Emily Barnes for allowing her negro man "Alfred" to hire his own time, & having an aversion to have her name connected with a Commonwealth trial, she send me a note telling me to take judgment imediately against her, which I did for $40 --

I think it would be right to remit this, for the reason that Mrs Barnes was utterly ignorant of any wrong in the premises & really cannot keep the boy at home & control him -- She is a pure & good lady & I am constrained to ask this of you without any knowledge or solicitation on her part, but as a matter of pure justice to an estimable friend of both yours & mine.

Respectfully Yours
J. S. Drury, Comth Atty.

Remit all except fees & costs.
Tho E Bramlette

Montgomery Cr Ct
vs
Mrs Emily Barnes
$40 --
14th Mch 1864
